infodynamics.measures.continuous

Interface EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian, EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKernel, EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateKozachenko

    public interface EntropyCalculatorMultiVariate
    Interface for implementations of entropy estimators on continuous multivariate data (ie double[][] arrays where first index is time or observation number, second is variable index).

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator;
    2. Set properties using setProperty(String, String);
    3. Initialise the calculator initialise(int);
    4. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using: setObservations(double[][]);
    5. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average entropy: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • the local entropy values for these samples: computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
      • local entropy values for a specific set of samples: #computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[]).
    6. Return to step 2 or 3 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
      Compute the entropy from the previously-supplied samples.
      double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
      Compute the local entropy values for each of the previously-supplied samples.
      double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] newObservations)
      Compute the local entropy values for each of the supplied samples in newObservations.
      double getLastAverage()
      Return the entropy last calculated in a call to computeAverageLocalOfObservations() or computeLocalOfPreviousObservations() after the previous initialise(int) call.
      int getNumObservations()
      Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to setObservations(double[][]).
      void initialise(int dimensions)
      Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with the existing (or default) values of calculator-specific parameters.
      void setDebug(boolean debug)
      Set or clear debug mode for extra debug printing to stdout
      void setObservations(double[][] observations)
      Set the observations for which to compute the PDFs for the entropy Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        void initialise(int dimensions)
        Initialise the calculator for (re-)use, with the existing (or default) values of calculator-specific parameters. Clears any PDFs of previously supplied observations.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - number of joint variables to be investigated

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
               java.lang.String propertyValue)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Set properties for the underlying calculator implementation. New property values are not guaranteed to take effect until the next call to an initialise method.

        No general properties are defined at the interface level, i.e. there are only calculator-specific properties.

        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property
        propertyValue - value of the property
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for invalid property values

      • setObservations

        void setObservations(double[][] observations)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the observations for which to compute the PDFs for the entropy Should only be called once, the last call contains the observations that are used (they are not accumulated).
        Parameters:
        observations - multivariate time series of observations; first index is time step, second index is variable number (total should match dimensions supplied to initialise(int)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the dimensions of the observations do not match the expected value supplied in initialise(int); implementations may throw other more specific exceptions also.

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
        Compute the entropy from the previously-supplied samples.
        Returns:
        the entropy estimate, in bits or nats depending on the estimator.

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations(double[][] newObservations)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the local entropy values for each of the supplied samples in newObservations.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations, but not those in newObservations (unless they were some of the previously supplied samples).

        Parameters:
        newObservations - multivariate time-series for which to compute local entropy values (see setObservations(double[][]) for its format)
        Returns:
        time-series of local entropy values corresponding to each entry in newObservations
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalOfPreviousObservations

        double[] computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the local entropy values for each of the previously-supplied samples.

        PDFs are computed using all of the previously supplied observations.

        Returns:
        the array of local entropy values corresponding to each previously supplied observation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLastAverage

        double getLastAverage()
        Return the entropy last calculated in a call to computeAverageLocalOfObservations() or computeLocalOfPreviousObservations() after the previous initialise(int) call.
        Returns:
        the last computed entropy value

      • setDebug

        void setDebug(boolean debug)
        Set or clear debug mode for extra debug printing to stdout
        Parameters:
        debug - new setting for debug mode (on/off)

      • getNumObservations

        int getNumObservations()
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the number of samples to be used for the PDFs here which have been supplied by calls to setObservations(double[][]).
        Returns:
        the number of samples to be used for the PDFs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
